lessons.title: What is CSS?
lessons.content: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets. It is used to style and layout web pages.

lessons.title: Center Text Using CSS
lessons.question: Center the text horizontally using inline CSS style.

lessons.title: Ways to Apply CSS
lessons.content: CSS can be applied in three ways: Inline, Internal (in a <style> tag), and External (linked .css file).

lessons.title: CSS Selectors
lessons.content: Selectors target HTML elements to apply styles. Examples: element (p), class (.className), ID (#idName).

lessons.question: Which selector targets elements with a specific class?

lessons.title: Common Properties
lessons.content: Common CSS properties include color, font-size, background-color, margin, padding, etc.

lessons.title: What is the Box Model?
lessons.content: Every HTML element is a box with margins, borders, padding, and the actual content.

lessons.title: Padding vs Margin
lessons.content: Padding is the space inside the border. Margin is the space outside the element.
